diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of oropharyngeal histoplasmosis was supported by the presence of Histoplasma capsulatum in biopsy specimens, clinical history of pain and lesions in the oral cavity, and positive serologic tests for anti-Histoplasma antibodies. The patient had a prior history of latent infection and local immunosuppression due to radiation therapy for laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma.
